items.title: Democrats Pitch Bill to Protect Speech Targeted by Trump
items.summary: A group of House and Senate Democrats said they would introduce a measure that would bolster legal protections for people targeted by the government for speaking freely.

items.title: Judge Blocks Administration From Immediately Removing Guatemalan Children
items.summary: Judge Timothy J. Kelly, a Trump appointee, wrote that the government had given dubious justifications for removing the children that “crumbled like a house of cards.”

items.title: U.S. to Cut Out Nongovernmental Groups in Refocusing Health Aid
items.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the United States would negotiate agreements to deliver aid in new ways and would focus on the Western Hemisphere and Asia Pacific.

items.title: In Texas, Parents Fighting Vaccinations Say Their Movement Is Winning
items.summary: Public health advocates hoped that the measles outbreak might persuade the reluctant to get shots. That has not turned out to be true.

items.title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Allow Removal of Fed Governor
items.summary: President Trump had pressed to fire Lisa Cook before the central bank’s meeting, at which the Fed voted to cut interest rates.

items.title: Man Dies After Roller Coaster Ride at Epic Universe
items.summary: The authorities are investigating the death of the visitor to Universal’s new theme park in Orlando, which opened in May.

items.title: Trump threatens networks who give him ‘bad publicity’ as top Democrat accuses him of trying to ‘snuff out free speech’ – live
items.summary: <p>Amid Jimmy Kimmel furor, US president suggests media networks who cover him negatively could lose licenses; Chuck Schumer says Trump’s actions put US on ‘road to autocracy’</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/18/jimmy-kimmel-suspended-trump">Trump gleeful as Jimmy Kimmel talkshow taken off air</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2025/sep/18/jimmy-kimmel-suspension-sparks-shock-fears-for-free-speech-censoring-realtime">Kimmel suspension sparks shock and fears for free speech</a></p></li></ul><p>In reaction to the news that <strong>Jimmy Kimmel’</strong>s late-night show has been indefinitely suspended, the <strong>American Federation of Musicians (AFM)</strong> said that “Trump’s FCC identified speech it did not like and threatened ABC with extreme reprisals. This is state censorship.”</p><p>On X, the president of the American Federation of Musicians of the United States and Canada, <strong>Tino Gagliardi</strong>, issued a statement in response to <strong>ABC</strong> taking <strong>Jimmy Kimmel Live!</strong>, which employs musicians from the <strong>American Federation of Musicians Local 47</strong> in <strong>Los Angeles</strong>, off the air. In it he said:</p><p>This is not complicated: Trump’s FCC identified speech it did not like and theatened ABC with extreme reprisals. This is state censorship. It’s now happening in the United States of America, not some far-off country.

items.title: Calls grow to boycott ABC owner Disney over Jimmy Kimmel suspension
items.summary: <p>Critics say ‘authoritarianism isn’t coming – it’s already here’ amid widespread condemnation of talkshow’s suspension</p><p>The indefinite suspension of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/jimmy-kimmel">Jimmy Kimmel’s</a> late-night show has prompted impassioned calls for a boycott against Disney, ABC’s parent company, and other major media conglomerates that have refused to air Kimmel’s show.</p><p>Boycott calls grew after ABC announced it would <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/18/jimmy-kimmel-suspended-trump">indefinitely suspend </a>the popular show following complaints from Federal Communications Commission chairman Brendan Carr. Carr’s complaints stem from Kimmel’s recent monologue in which he addressed the killing of rightwing activist Charlie Kirk <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/18/what-did-jimmy-kimmel-say-said-comments-about-charlie-kirk">by saying:</a> “Many in Maga land are working very hard to capitalize on the murder of Charlie Kirk.”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/18/jimmy-kimmel-cancelled-disney-boycott">Continue reading...</a>
